snippet: The Greek filmmaker Athina Rachel Tsangari’s deadpan movie “Attenberg,” opening Friday at IFC Center, deals with timeless subjects: sex and death.
abstract: Greek filmmaker Athina Rachel Tsangari’s deadpan movie Attenberg tackles timeless subjects of sex and death; Tsangari is unashamed of her varied film influences and acknowledges that ultimately the film is a love story.
lead_paragraph: The Greek filmmaker Athina Rachel Tsangari’s deadpan movie “Attenberg,” opening Friday at IFC Center, deals with timeless subjects: sex and death.

headline.main: Born of 1,000 Influences, an Original Look at Love
headline.print_headline: Born of 1,000 Influences, An Original Look at Love
